dt.t: students who frequently {wi}misbehave{/wi} themselves in class

dt: {bc}to behave with poor manners or a lack of courtesy

dt.t: He worried about the decline of family discipline, about the fact that local youth went out walking after dark, wasted time in levity, {wi}misbehaved{/wi} in church.

dt: {bc}to behave with disregard for accepted {d_link|moral|moral:1} standards especially in sexual matters

sls: of a member of the armed forces
dt: {bc}to behave before or in the presence of the enemy in a way that does not conform to military standards or practice

dt.t: … has been charged with desertion and {wi}misbehaving{/wi} before the enemy …

dt: {bc}to behave in an unexpected or unwelcome way

dt.t: After five floods in four years, people in Liberty County are used to seeing the Trinity River {wi}misbehave{/wi}.

shortdef: to behave with poor manners or a lack of courtesy
to behave with disregard for accepted moral standards especially in sexual matters
